channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: How a nonprofit CEO rallied 200 businesses to help score billions in childcare wins as part of Trump’s Big Beautiful Bill
item.description: "We're in a once-in-a-lifetime generational fight for childcare, and that means that we have to celebrate the wins even when they're imperfect."

item.title: Indeed and Glassdoor are cutting over 1,000 jobs. The CEO overseeing both companies says ‘we must adapt’ to AI
item.description: Glassdoor CEO Christian Sutherland-Wong is also out.

item.title: Bitcoin scores all-time high, blowing past $118,000 with room to run
item.description: A soft U.S. dollar and the digital currency friendliness of the Trump administration is helping things along.

item.title: Inside Gaza’s world of ‘cash brokers’ as currency disappears: ‘We lose nearly half of our money just to be able to spend it’
item.description: Sugar costs $80-$100 per kilogram (2.2 pounds), multiple people said; before the war, that cost less than $2.

item.title: Mark Zuckerberg is determined to build an AI superteam—and he’s poaching from Sam Altman with multimillion-dollar pay packages
item.description: Reports of $200 million and $300 million compensation packages are rattling the Valley.

item.title: Economic calendar: Federal budget update is Friday’s data highlight
Dow down 300 points as new Canada threat from Trump rattles Wall Street
Dow futures down 300 points, S&P 500, Nasdaq pressured after Canada tariff hit
Jorts, ‘quiet Western’ wear are helping Levi’s stave off the impact of tariffs
Is Amazon Prime Day losing its appeal? Early data hints shoppers spending less.
